solution_line_template: The {dog_current_human_years}-year-old dog ages {dog_age_factor} years to one human year so he will technically be {dog_current_human_years}*{dog_age_factor} = <<{dog_current_human_years}*{dog_age_factor}={dog_age_in_dog_years}>>{dog_age_in_dog_years} years old in dog years

Max's dog will be {dog_age_in_dog_years} when Max turns {max_age_human_years} so the age difference is {dog_age_in_dog_years}-{max_age_human_years} = <<{dog_age_in_dog_years}-{max_age_human_years}={age_difference}>>{age_difference}
